posts.name: Emmanuel Perez
posts.cooked:
Hi guys, i just uploaded my code to my swerve drive chassis made of Neos(SPARK MAX), the Thrifty Absolute Encoder, and Swerve X chassis and it just when crazy.

So when I loaded my code and enable the robot at TeleOp mode, it just when crazy and start moving without touching the controller, if you tried to move the angle or the direction it just didn’t react at any order from the controller.

I’ll put you a video where you could see how it acted.

If this has happened to someone else and found a solution, could you please help me too, pls? Heres my code , thanks!

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked: You command the drive motor in setAngle

posts.name: L Sao
posts.cooked: In your Constants.java, make sure modulekP = 1.0 / 90.0 so that you can be sure it is a double. Having zeroes can make not a number (NaN) errors occur that then cause unwanted movement.

posts.name: Emmanuel Perez
posts.cooked: My kP values on the swerve modules are placed directly from the chassis subsystem. Or you refer to another thing?

posts.name: Emmanuel Perez
posts.cooked:
So i changed that to make only one “motor.set” and I made sure to put turnMotor.set(pidValue); and now it gets crazy but with the turn motor. image 974×164 8.28 KB

image 974×164 8.28 KB

image 974×164 8.28 KB

Here’s a video of how it moves now.

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked:
Probably an issue with the polarity of your motor not matching the polarity of the encoder.

Begin by ensuring that positive voltage to the steer motor turns the wheel counterclockwise when looking from above. You can do this in code or with the Rev Hardware Client plugged into the spark max. If positive turns the wheel clockwise, invert the steer motor.

Once the motor polarity is correct, check to make sure positive voltage increases the encode position. If it decreases it, invert the encoder.

posts.name: Emmanuel Perez
posts.cooked: I checked all motors and all of them went counterclockwise, so now im trying to invert the encoder but I haven’t found that option or the way to do it. Do yoy know how to invert the Thrifty Absolute Encoder?
